monogr.title: Tvvo bookes of ayres : The first contayning diuine and morall songs: the second, light conceites of louers. To be sung to the lute and viols, in two, three, and foure parts: or by one voyce to an instrument. Composed by Thomas Campian
monogr.author: Campion, Thomas

div.head: TO THE READER.
div.p: OVT of many Songs which partly at the request of friends, partly for my owne recreation were by mee long since composed, I haue now enfranchised a few, sending them forth diuided according to their different subiect into seuerall Bookes. The first are graue and pious; the second amorous and light. For hee that in publishing any worke, hath a desire to content all palates, must cater for them accordingly.

q.l: Quod placet, hic Spinas colligit, ille Rosas.
